intro: Satyrium neilgherrensis, commonly known as the Neilgherry orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of India. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers with a distinctive coloration. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, often on rocky substrates. Its blooming period occurs during the spring and early summer, and it is known for its fragrant, nectar-rich flowers. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
